title: At Infosys we were building AI platform 10 years ago, now it is all in past: Vishal Sikka
description: In this article, explore the journey of Infosys's visionary leadership in artificial intelligence and its implications on India’s future.
content:
At Infosys, we were building an AI platform 10 years ago. Now, as the world watches from afar, it is all in past. Vishal Sikka, CEO of Infosys and its subsidiary Vianai, has been a key driver in this transformative journey.

#### Background

Vishal Sikka’s vision for artificial intelligence (AI) began long before many saw the potential to shape industries with technology as adaptive and reliable as human beings. Back then, 2014 was already when Infosys was pioneering its AI capabilities, focusing on how technology could transform business processes, making them more efficient and customer-centric.

Over the years, this vision has become reality, but it is not about building platforms just for the sake of it. It's about understanding what limitations AI can overcome, and finding ways to bridge the gap between humans and machines in a way that empowers human potential.

#### Key Developments

In 2014, Infosys launched its AI platform aimed at helping businesses adopt AI-driven solutions that could transform their operations. By 2024, the company has seen a significant shift, moving beyond just technology to integrate it into day-to-day life—making it an integral part of how people live and work.

This evolution is not without challenges. As Sikka points out, "Being effective with AI requires understanding its limitations." It's a balance between automation and human oversight that ensures AI tools are used correctly while still being humanly driven by the values we hold dear.

#### Industry Impact

The impact of Infosys’s efforts in artificial intelligence has been profound. The company has not only pushed boundaries but also created numerous job opportunities, especially among entrepreneurs looking to harness technology for personal growth and innovation. This shift towards AI-led entrepreneurship is poised to transform a billion Indian entrepreneurs into 'AI super-users,' leading them to unlock productivity gains through technology.

#### Expert Perspective

Vishal Sikka emphasizes the importance of bridging the LLM-enterprise gap. He notes, "Our success in AI has not been just about creating tools but also about understanding where these tools fall short and how we can bridge that gap with human-centric solutions." This approach ensures that while businesses use technology to enhance their operations, they do so with a human touch, making it accessible and meaningful.

#### What This Means

For those who have followed the journey of Infosys, this article offers an inside look at the company’s strategic vision and its evolution. It is not just about where they were 10 years ago but also about where they are today and what their future holds. The impact on India’s economy and society will continue to unfold as AI becomes an integral part of everyday life.

Looking ahead, Vishal Sikka envisions a future where technology seamlessly integrates with human values, making it not just a tool but a partner in the pursuit of better outcomes. This vision underscores his leadership's commitment to ensuring that artificial intelligence is used for societal good rather than merely for efficiency gains.

#### Conclusion

Infosys’s journey from a platform builder 10 years ago to an AI-led future has been marked by innovation and foresight. Vishal Sikka’s dedication and the company’s continued efforts in bridging the gap between technology and humanity have set a new standard not just for Infosys but for all those aspiring to leverage artificial intelligence effectively.

This article concludes with a call to action, urging readers to reflect on how they can contribute to this future where AI is used as an enabler rather than a barrier, ensuring that the benefits of technology are available to everyone.
